No, nobody can access your computer over IRC.
UNLESS you tend to accept every .exe someone sends to you.
I have accepted nothing .exe so how could all my start up scripts become so corrupted?
I don't know. But I am sure it is not related to you being on IRC.
There's an environment variable $PATH that contains a list of directories where to search for programs if you don't specify a path.
For example, 'ls' is in /bin, and /bin is in $PATH, so you only type 'ls'
in what path?
echo "$PATH"
And if you want to run a program that is not in $PATH, you need to specify the full path.
No, the current directory is never in $PATH by default.
./someprogram means "run someprogram from the current directory"
But you did specify the path - by using ./
. means the current directory, and ./uninstall means a file "uninstall" in the current directory.
